Mrs. Price.text: It was a lovely morning , and at that season of the year a fine morning so often turned off , that it was wisest for everybody not to delay their exercise ”

Fanny.text: then by this time it is all settled , ”

Mr. Crawford.text: Would she not , then , persuade her daughters to take advantage of such weather , and allow him the pleasure of attending them ? ”
Her daughters were very much confined ; Portsmouth was a sad place ; they did not often get out ; and she knew they had some errands in the town , which they would be very glad to do . ”
Come , girls ; come , Fan ; come , Sue , take care of yourselves ; keep a sharp lookout ! ”

what a society will be comprised in those houses ! And at Michaelmas , perhaps , a fourth may be added : some small hunting - box in the vicinity of everything so dear ; for as to any partnership in Thornton Lacey , as Edmund Bertram once good - humouredly proposed , I hope I foresee two objections : two fair , excellent , irresistible objections to that plan . ”
